00039  * These are the only exported functions, they provide some generic
00040  * infrastructure for managing object devices

00079 /* buffer MUST be at least the size of obd_ioctl_hdr */
00080 int obd_ioctl_getdata(char **buf, int *len, void __user *arg)
00081 {
00082         struct obd_ioctl_hdr hdr;
00083         struct obd_ioctl_data *data;
00084         int offset = 0;
00085         ENTRY;
00086 
00087         if (copy_from_user(&hdr, arg, sizeof(hdr)))
00088                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00089 
00090         if (hdr.ioc_version != OBD_IOCTL_VERSION) {
00091                 CERROR("Version mismatch kernel (%x) vs application (%x)\n",
00092                        OBD_IOCTL_VERSION, hdr.ioc_version);
00093                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00094         }
00095 
00096         if (hdr.ioc_len > OBD_MAX_IOCTL_BUFFER) {
00097                 CERROR("User buffer len %d exceeds %d max buffer\n",
00098                        hdr.ioc_len, OBD_MAX_IOCTL_BUFFER);
00099                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00100         }
00101 
00102         if (hdr.ioc_len < sizeof(struct obd_ioctl_data)) {
00103                 CERROR("User buffer too small for ioctl (%d)\n", hdr.ioc_len);
00104                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00105         }
00106 
00107         /* When there are lots of processes calling vmalloc on multi-core
00108          * system, the high lock contention will hurt performance badly,
00109          * obdfilter-survey is an example, which relies on ioctl. So we'd
00110          * better avoid vmalloc on ioctl path. LU-66 */
00111         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(*buf, hdr.ioc_len);
00112         if (*buf == NULL) {
00113                 CERROR("Cannot allocate control buffer of len %d\n",
00114                        hdr.ioc_len);
00115                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00116         }
00117         *len = hdr.ioc_len;
00118         data = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)*buf;
00119 
00120         if (copy_from_user(*buf, arg, hdr.ioc_len)) {
00121                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(*buf, hdr.ioc_len);
00122                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00123         }
00124 
00125         if (obd_ioctl_is_invalid(data)) {
00126                 CERROR("ioctl not correctly formatted\n");
00127                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(*buf, hdr.ioc_len);
00128                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00129         }
00130 
00131         if (data->ioc_inllen1) {
00132                 data->ioc_inlbuf1 = &data->ioc_bulk[0];
00133                 offset += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen1);
00134         }
00135 
00136         if (data->ioc_inllen2) {
00137                 data->ioc_inlbuf2 = &data->ioc_bulk[0] + offset;
00138                 offset += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen2);
00139         }
00140 
00141         if (data->ioc_inllen3) {
00142                 data->ioc_inlbuf3 = &data->ioc_bulk[0] + offset;
00143                 offset += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen3);
00144         }
00145 
00146         if (data->ioc_inllen4)
00147                 data->ioc_inlbuf4 = &data->ioc_bulk[0] + offset;
00148 
00149         RETURN(0);
00150 }
00151 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_ioctl_getdata);
00152 
00153 int obd_ioctl_popdata(void __user *arg, void *data, int len)
00154 {
00155         int err;
00156         ENTRY;
00157 
00158         err = copy_to_user(arg, data, len) ? -EFAULT : 0;
00159         RETURN(err);
00160 }

00162 /*  opening /dev/obd */
00163 static int obd_class_open(struct inode * inode, struct file * file)
00164 {
00165         ENTRY;
00166 
00167         try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
00168         RETURN(0);
00169 }
00170 
00171 /*  closing /dev/obd */
00172 static int obd_class_release(struct inode * inode, struct file * file)
00173 {
00174         ENTRY;
00175 
00176         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
00177         RETURN(0);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /* to control /dev/obd */
00181 static long obd_class_ioctl(struct file *filp, unsigned int cmd,
00182                             unsigned long arg)
00183 {
00184         int err = 0;
00185         ENTRY;
00186 
00187         /* Allow non-root access for OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET - used by lfs check */
00188         if (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN) && (cmd != OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET))
00189                 RETURN(err = -EACCES);
00190         if ((cmd & 0xffffff00) == ((int)'T') << 8) /* ignore all tty ioctls */
00191                 RETURN(err = -ENOTTY);
00192 
00193         err = class_handle_ioctl(cmd, (unsigned long)arg);
00194 
00195         RETURN(err);
00196 }
00197 
00198 /* declare character device */
00199 static struct file_operations obd_psdev_fops = {
00200         .owner          = THIS_MODULE,
00201         .unlocked_ioctl = obd_class_ioctl, /* unlocked_ioctl */
00202         .open           = obd_class_open,      /* open */
00203         .release        = obd_class_release,   /* release */
00204 };
00205 
00206 /* modules setup */
00207 struct miscdevice obd_psdev = {
00208         .minor = OBD_DEV_MINOR,
00209         .name  = OBD_DEV_NAME,
00210         .fops  = &obd_psdev_fops,
00211 };

00224 static int obd_proc_pinger_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00225 {
00226         seq_printf(m, "%s\n",
00227 #ifdef ENABLE_PINGER
00228                    "on"
00229 #else
00230                    "off"
00231 #endif
00232                  );
00233         return 0;
00234 }
00235 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(obd_proc_pinger);
00236 
00245 static int obd_proc_health_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00246 {
00247         bool healthy = true;
00248         int i;
00249 
00250         if (libcfs_catastrophe)
00251                 seq_printf(m, "LBUG\n");
00252 
00253         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00254         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00255                 struct obd_device *obd;
00256 
00257                 obd = class_num2obd(i);
00258                 if (obd == NULL || !obd->obd_attached || !obd->obd_set_up)
00259                         continue;
00260 
00261                 LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00262                 if (obd->obd_stopping)
00263                         continue;
00264 
00265                 class_incref(obd, __FUNCTION__, current);
00266                 read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00267 
00268                 if (obd_health_check(NULL, obd)) {
00269                         seq_printf(m, "device %s reported unhealthy\n",
00270                                    obd->obd_name);
00271                         healthy = false;
00272                 }
00273                 class_decref(obd, __FUNCTION__, current);
00274                 read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00275         }
00276         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00277 
00278         if (healthy)
00279                 seq_puts(m, "healthy\n");
00280         else
00281                 seq_puts(m, "NOT HEALTHY\n");
00282         return 0;
00283 }
00284 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(obd_proc_health);
00285 
00286 static int obd_proc_jobid_var_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00287 {
00288         if (strlen(obd_jobid_var) != 0)
00289                 seq_printf(m, "%s\n", obd_jobid_var);
00290         return 0;
00291 }
00292 
00293 static ssize_t
00294 obd_proc_jobid_var_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00295                              size_t count, loff_t *off)
00296 {
00297         if (!count || count > JOBSTATS_JOBID_VAR_MAX_LEN)
00298                 return -EINVAL;
00299 
00300         memset(obd_jobid_var, 0, JOBSTATS_JOBID_VAR_MAX_LEN + 1);
00301 
00302         /* This might leave the var invalid on error, which is probably fine.*/
00303         if (copy_from_user(obd_jobid_var, buffer, count))
00304                 return -EFAULT;
00305 
00306         /* Trim the trailing '\n' if any */
00307         if (obd_jobid_var[count - 1] == '\n')
00308                 obd_jobid_var[count - 1] = 0;
00309 
00310         return count;
00311 }
00312 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(obd_proc_jobid_var);
00313 
00314 static int obd_proc_jobid_name_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00315 {
00316         if (strlen(obd_jobid_node) != 0)
00317                 seq_printf(m, "%s\n", obd_jobid_node);
00318         return 0;
00319 }
00320 
00321 static ssize_t obd_proc_jobid_name_seq_write(struct file *file,
00322                                              const char __user *buffer,
00323                                              size_t count, loff_t *off)
00324 {
00325         if (count == 0 || count > LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE)
00326                 return -EINVAL;
00327 
00328         /* clear previous value */
00329         memset(obd_jobid_node, 0, LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE);
00330 
00331         if (copy_from_user(obd_jobid_node, buffer, count))
00332                 return -EFAULT;
00333 
00334         /* Trim the trailing '\n' if any */
00335         if (obd_jobid_node[count - 1] == '\n') {
00336                 /* Don't echo just a newline */
00337                 if (count == 1)
00338                         return -EINVAL;
00339                 obd_jobid_node[count - 1] = 0;
00340         }
00341 
00342         return count;
00343 }
00344 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(obd_proc_jobid_name);
00345 
00346 /* Root for /proc/fs/lustre */
00347 struct proc_dir_entry *proc_lustre_root = NULL;
00348 EXPORT_SYMBOL(proc_lustre_root);

00350 static struct lprocfs_vars lprocfs_base[] = {
00351         { .name =       "version",
00352           .fops =       &obd_proc_version_fops  },
00353         { .name =       "pinger",
00354           .fops =       &obd_proc_pinger_fops   },
00355         { .name =       "health_check",
00356           .fops =       &obd_proc_health_fops   },
00357         { .name =       "jobid_var",
00358           .fops =       &obd_proc_jobid_var_fops},
00359         { .name =       "jobid_name",
00360           .fops =       &obd_proc_jobid_name_fops},
00361         { NULL }
00362 };
00363 #else
00364 #define lprocfs_base NULL
00365 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */

00367 static void *obd_device_list_seq_start(struct seq_file *p, loff_t *pos)
00368 {
00369         if (*pos >= class_devno_max())
00370                 return NULL;
00371 
00372         return pos;
00373 }
00374 
00375 static void obd_device_list_seq_stop(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
00376 {
00377 }
00378 
00379 static void *obd_device_list_seq_next(struct seq_file *p, void *v, loff_t *pos)
00380 {
00381         ++*pos;
00382         if (*pos >= class_devno_max())
00383                 return NULL;
00384 
00385         return pos;
00386 }
00387 
00388 static int obd_device_list_seq_show(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
00389 {
00390         loff_t index = *(loff_t *)v;
00391         struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd((int)index);
00392         char *status;
00393 
00394         if (obd == NULL)
00395                 return 0;
00396 
00397         LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00398         if (obd->obd_stopping)
00399                 status = "ST";
00400         else if (obd->obd_inactive)
00401                 status = "IN";
00402         else if (obd->obd_set_up)
00403                 status = "UP";
00404         else if (obd->obd_attached)
00405                 status = "AT";
00406         else
00407                 status = "--";
00408 
00409         seq_printf(p, "%3d %s %s %s %s %d\n",
00410                    (int)index, status, obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00411                    obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid,
00412                    atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
00413         return 0;
00414 }
00415 
00416 static const struct seq_operations obd_device_list_sops = {
00417         .start = obd_device_list_seq_start,
00418         .stop = obd_device_list_seq_stop,
00419         .next = obd_device_list_seq_next,
00420         .show = obd_device_list_seq_show,
00421 };
00422 
00423 static int obd_device_list_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00424 {
00425         struct seq_file *seq;
00426         int rc = seq_open(file, &obd_device_list_sops);
00427 
00428         if (rc)
00429                 return rc;
00430 
00431         seq = file->private_data;
00432         seq->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
00433         return 0;
00434 }
00435 
00436 static const struct file_operations obd_device_list_fops = {
00437         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
00438         .open    = obd_device_list_open,
00439         .read    = seq_read,
00440         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
00441         .release = seq_release,
00442 };
00443 
00444 int class_procfs_init(void)
00445 {
00446         struct proc_dir_entry *entry;
00447         int rc;
00448         ENTRY;
00449 
00450         obd_sysctl_init();
00451 
00452         entry = lprocfs_register("fs/lustre", NULL, lprocfs_base, NULL);
00453         if (IS_ERR(entry)) {
00454                 rc = PTR_ERR(entry);
00455                 CERROR("cannot create '/proc/fs/lustre': rc = %d\n", rc);
00456                 RETURN(rc);
00457         }
00458 
00459         proc_lustre_root = entry;
00460 
00461         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(proc_lustre_root, "devices", 0444,
00462                                 &obd_device_list_fops, NULL);
00463         if (rc < 0) {
00464                 CERROR("cannot create '/proc/fs/lustre/devices': rc = %d\n",
00465                        rc);
00466                 GOTO(out_proc, rc);
00467         }
00468 
00469         RETURN(rc);
00470 
00471 out_proc:
00472         lprocfs_remove(&proc_lustre_root);
00473 
00474         RETURN(rc);
00475 }
00476 
00477 int class_procfs_clean(void)
00478 {
00479         ENTRY;
00480         if (proc_lustre_root) {
00481                 lprocfs_remove(&proc_lustre_root);
00482         }
00483         RETURN(0);
00484 }
